Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies are trailing the Mets, two games to one, in a National League Division Series where three losses would eliminate them.
The Phillies need to win on Wednesday just to earn the right to continue playing, and they will have to do it in front of 44,000 Mets fans.
The Phillies have brought 26 players with them to Flushing, and all of them can do the math regarding the stakes of the game.
In the three previous postseasons, eight teams found themselves in this situation, and six of them lost the series the next day.
The Mets have split the first two games on the road and are undefeated in such series.
Kyle Schwarber believes the Phillies can draw inspiration from the 2016 Cubs' comeback from a 3-1 deficit in the World Series.
The Phillies' bullpen has allowed 17 hits and 13 runs in nine innings, with two blown saves and eight inherited runners allowed to score.
The Mets are 14-3 over the last three seasons in games in which the Phillies have started Wheeler or Nola.
The Mets are 2-0 in the Wheeler/Nola starts in this NLDS and 0-1 when anyone else starts.
